article.headline: Mississippi Valley State 52, Alabama State 44
article.story:
MONTGOMERY, Ala. (AP) -- With 12 points, Stanford Speech led Mississippi Valley State to a 52-44 victory over Alabama State Monday night.

The Delta Devils (11-12, 8-3 Southwestern Athletic Conference) led 32-21 at the half and widened their lead to 14 points in the first minute of the second half.

Both teams had just one double digit scorer. The Hornets' Richard Lott matched Speech's game-high 12 points.

The Delta Devils shot 44.7 percent from the floor, while the Hornets (7-15, 5-6 SWAC) only managed 29.8 percent.

Both teams struggled from 3-point range -- the Delta Devils were 3-for-10 and the Hornets were 2-for-16.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
